bill.title: A resolution to provide for related procedures concerning the articles of impeachment against Donald John Trump, President of the United States.
bill.description: This resolution sets forth related procedures for consideration of the articles of impeachment against the President that include filing of certain records of the articles of impeachment by the House of Representatives; establishing deadlines by which the President and the House must file certain motions related to the articles and any responses to the motions; providing guidelines for arguments on such motions and presentations by the House and the President; authorizing Senators to question parties; making it in order, after deliberation by the Senate, for the Senate to vote on a motion to consider and debate, under the impeachment rules, any motion to subpoena witnesses or documents; making it in order, following the disposition of that question, other motions provided under such rules; requiring the Senate to depose such witnesses and decide which witnesses shall testify, if it agrees to allow the House or the President to subpoena witnesses; making testimony inadmissible unless the parties have had an opportunity to depose such witnesses; and requiring the Senate to vote on each article of impeachment at the conclusion of its deliberations.

history.action: Submitted in the Senate.
Measure laid before Senate. (consideration: CR S377-431)
S.Amdt.1284 Amendment SA 1284 proposed by Senator Schumer. (consideration: CR S385-386, S386-394; text: CR S385-386) To subpoena certain White House documents and records.
S.Amdt.1284 Motion to table amendment SA 1284 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 47. Record Vote Number: 15.
S.Amdt.1285 Amendment SA 1285 proposed by Senator Schumer. (consideration: CR S394-395, S395-401; text: CR S394) To subpoena certain Department of State documents and records.
S.Amdt.1285 Motion to table amendment SA 1285 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 47. Record Vote Number: 16.
S.Amdt.1286 Amendment SA 1286 proposed by Senator Schumer. (consideration: S401-406; text: CR S401-402) To subpoena certain Office of Management and Budget documents and records.
S.Amdt.1286 Motion to table amendment SA 1286 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 47. Record Vote Number: 17.
S.Amdt.1287 Amendment SA 1287 proposed by Senator Schumer. (consideration: CR S406, S406-412; text: CR S406) To subpoena John Michael "Mick" Mulvaney.
S.Amdt.1287 Motion to table amendment SA 1287 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 47. Record Vote Number: 18.
S.Amdt.1288 Amendment SA 1288 proposed by Senator Schumer. (consideration: CR S412-416; text: CR S412-413) To subpoena certain Department of Defense documents and records.
S.Amdt.1288 Motion to table amendment SA 1288 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 47. Record Vote Number: 19.
S.Amdt.1289 Amendment SA 1289 proposed by Senator Schumer. (consideration: CR S416-420; text: CR S416) To subpoena Robert B. Blair and Michael P. Duffey.
S.Amdt.1289 Motion to table amendment SA 1289 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 47. Record Vote Number: 20.

S.Amdt.1290 Amendment SA 1290 proposed by Senator Schumer. (consideration: S420, S420-422; text: CR S420) To prevent the selective admission of evidence and to provide for appropriate handling of classified and confidential materials.
S.Amdt.1290 Motion to table amendment SA 1290 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 47. Record Vote Number: 21.
S.Amdt.1291 Amendment SA 1291 proposed by Senator Schumer. (consideration: S422-428; text: CR S422-423) To subpoena John Robert Bolton.
S.Amdt.1291 Motion to table amendment SA 1291 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 47. Record Vote Number: 22.

S.Amdt.1292 Amendment SA 1292 proposed by Senator Schumer. (consideration: CR S428-429; text: CR S428) To provide that motions to subpoena witnesses or documents shall be in order after the question period.
S.Amdt.1292 Motion to table amendment SA 1292 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 47. Record Vote Number: 23.
S.Amdt.1293 Amendment SA 1293 proposed by Senator Schumer. (consideration: CR S429-430; text: CR S429) To allow additional time to file responses to motions.
S.Amdt.1293 Motion to table amendment SA 1293 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 48. Record Vote Number: 24.

S.Amdt.1294 Amendment SA 1294 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Van Hollen. (consideration: CR S430-431; text: CR S430) To help ensure impartial justice by requiring the Chief Justice of the United States to rule on motions to subpoena witnesses and documents.
S.Amdt.1294 Motion to table amendment SA 1294 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 47. Record Vote Number: 25.
Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 47. Record Vote Number: 26. (text: CR S377-378)

subjects.subject_name: Government ethics and transparency, public corruption
Presidents and presidential powers, Vice Presidents
